Text.Page:
, there have been reports about an extraordinary phenomenon involving Smoldering Bloodshards in and around Castanica.

Sophilia has requested our assistance. Please head to Firebase Intrepid in Fyrmount and give her a hand.

I have enclosed a Teleport Scroll with this order. Please hurry.

- Seir

Desperate for help, Sophilia sent an urgent request for aid from Castanica. Seir, once again sent to investigate. Arriving at Castanica, could not believe what was happening: The area was covered in Smoldering Bloodshards.
Led by a researcher named Loomey, entered Bahaar's Sanctum, the source of the Fyrmount.

There, faced the Fire Lord himself.

At last!
I was hoping they would send you, .

The Smoldering Bloodshards are flaring, and spewing Toxic Gas everywhere...it's out of control.

Sophilia has gone to evacuate civilians from the areas that were hit the hardest.

I'll show you where she is. Please go help her.

! I'm so glad Seir sent you!

I don't think I have to explain what's going on down here. I've evacuated most of the civilians, but there's many wounded left.

But the Smoldering Bloodshards are spreading at an insane pace. It's only a matter of time before they'll be in Castanica.

We can't let that happen."Any idea what's causing this?"

I'm not sure...
Everything happened so fast, I didn't have time to investigate. But this man, Loomey, claims that he knows the reason for all of this.

He was just about to tell me about it. , please come with me.

Greetings. My name is Loomey. I'm something of a wandering researcher.

Since we don't have much time, I'll keep this brief.
Smoldering Bloodshards grow naturally on lava. But based on how fast they're spreading...I can only assume that Fyrmount is somehow over-producing energy.

There must be something happening deep down the volcano."What can we do to stop it?"

There's one way...but far too dangerous.
I couldn't do anything even if I were to go there.

Wait...aren't you ?
I've been all over the world in my travels...and there wasn't a single place where people didn't know you...and they all spoke highly of you.

I think you can help fix this problem, if you're willing to risk it."I'll do whatever it takes."

Good. We have no time to lose.

Meet me at the giant Smoldering Bloodshard near Firebase Valor.

I'll put together a more detailed plan, and have it ready for you when you arrive.

The volcano is causing all this?
How in the goddess's name could he possibly know that?

I still have my doubts, but if it keeps Castanica safe, that's all that matters.

, please go and help Loomey.
I'm counting on you.

This giant Smoldering Bloodshard...
It's been growing here for quite some time.

If we can sever the connection between the volcano and the bloodshards, this should all come to an end.

Take this talisman.
Use it to disconnect the volcano and bloodshards.

Are you...okay?
The talisman didn't work...? Why did it not work? Unless...?"Unless what?"

It's the worst possible scenario...

I prayed that this would not come to pass.

Okay. We have no other choice now.

I need to get closer to the source of this power...

Follow me.
Oh, Arun, this wasn't supposed to happen yet! Why now?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What happened?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

I've encountered this overwhelming power before...

This is Bahaar...the Fire Lord. A very old god.

But it's impossible for his power to have grown so great... No! Something must have happened to the seal!"What seal?"

, I can feel that you have been blessed by the gods.

Of all mortals, you are truly worthy...worthy enough to know the secrets of the gods.

Allow me to reintroduce myself.

I am Halrath the Traveler.

I apologize: I did not mean to deceive you by concealing my true self.

I had to save my strength, to be prepared for the worst possible scenario."What would that be?"

Bahaar regaining his full power...and thereby destroying the world.

What you are seeing here is only an omen.
Once Bahaar has fully recovered, everything you have ever known will be burned to ashes.

I do not know what happened in the Sanctum, but we will both need all of our strength to stop Bahaar."How do we do that?"

Nothing is left of Bahaar but rage and fury. We have no choice but to seal him up inside his sanctum.

, you must help me get inside. I have to see for myself what has happened. Of all this world's heroes, I think you are the most capable of helping me.

Bahaar's Sanctum lies at the end of Fyrmount. You'll need a flying mount to reach it. I'll wait for you at the entrance.

I see you made it, .

Before you is the entrance to Bahaar's Sanctum.

Only the most worthy can enter."It's certainly off the beaten path."

Balder intended that the Sanctum would be isolated from the world.

It appears to be an featureless cave, in a nearly unreachable place, because the gods did not want anyone discovering it by chance.

But because you have long since proven yourself worthy, you are able to see what ordinary mortals cannot.

Let us make haste.
(There's an oddly familiar feeling of power here...but it is not coming from Balder's Seal.)

That dragon...so much like Vergos...

Whatever its origin, the dragon failed to achieve its goal.

There's barely any trace of it on the wind.

Still, it broke the seal, and now it's only a matter of time before Bahaar awakens.

Nothing will be left of him now...but pure rage."Is there anything we can do?"

I can try to restore the seal...but it will take time.

You will have to prevent Bahaar from leaving. Once I've restored the seal, Bahaar will be imprisoned again.

Good luck.

It's not perfect, but it's near enough. Thanks to you, I was able to restore the barrier that Balder created.

If only Bahaar truly knew what Balder wanted for him, this would have never happened...

Bahaar, was the noblest warrior of us all. If Bahaar awakened at the right time, he would have been the mightiest shield protecting Arborea."He was indeed a formidable opponent."

I should stay here and guard the seal.

Bahaar has been interred here in Fyrmount for such a long time, I can still faintly sense his presence deep within the mountains.

Now, though, there is not left of him but pure fire...without the rage.

Of course, if Bahaar awakens again, it could be a different story.

Here, take this.
I hope we can meet again, .
